title: I Tried to Create a Drug that Condensed Sleep - Part 1
body:
Let's be honest, getting 8 hours of sleep every night is impossible. Especially if you're a student or have work. Nobody likes being short on sleep, but it's something we all go through. This is what I tried to fix, but it went horribly wrong. So wrong, that I'm now on here. I need to take you back to the beginning. Back in 1988.

I was a young man (I physically still am) fresh out of college, and still foolish enough to think I could climb any mountain. My classmate, Eddie, and I had come up with a brilliant idea. At least I thought it was brilliant. It was a bad idea and I was unsuspecting. Blind to Eddie's true nature.

We planned to create a pill that would augment sleep. It would double it. If someone slept 4 hours, they'd feel like they had gotten 8 hours of sleep. With 3 hours, it would feel like 6 hours, and so on. This would be invaluable for students or anybody with a demanding schedule.

I'm not even going to attempt to explain how the pills worked. Eddie and I were business majors, not medicine or chemistry experts. That was where Eddie's friend, Mike, came in. We all had a role in this: Eddie had a rich family, so he was the funding. We didn't need any loans thanks to him. Mike was the science. And I was the salesman. I was the most charismatic of our group, and I'd be the best salesman. My role would mainly be sidelined until we achieved success.

I'm not sure what was in the drug, but I'd bet a big stack of cash it wasn't all legal. Probably some narcotics, depressants, or hallucinogens. Like I said, I'm not a chemist.

The process was uneventful at first. In fact, I barely saw the other two in this time. Mike was doing his work, with help from Eddie's money of course. Because I had not yet landed any jobs associated with my degree, I still worked as a cashier at a shitty little corner store. The rest of time was spent with my fiance, Jane.

She objected to the project because of Eddie. She always thought he was a creep. She relented when it was clear I wasn't going to abandon this business venture. God I wish I had listened to her.

After about 2 months of trial and error, Mike had a pill he was satisfied with. Of course, no people had taken it yet. But he knew it was nontoxic. We would be sampling the pills ourselves.

I took mine when I had an early shift at the store. I went to sleep a lot later than usual - about 3 hours before I had to wake up. And with that pill, I felt fine. I didn't feel tired or deprived at all. I was ecstatic.

But there was a downside. I couldn't sleep that night, or even the next night. And it felt like my blood was itching. I'm no chemist but I still knew what withdrawal was. I had to tell Mike to fix that. I wasn't panicked until the night after.

Even though I couldn't sleep, I could still dream. That night I was simply watching TV since I had nothing else to do. I reached for the remote, only to scream. I saw not a remote, but a severed hand. I dry heaved, but nothing came out.

I staggered away from the hand only to bump into someone. I turned around to see a thermal human yelling violently at me. I tried to run but my legs moved slow, just like they do in dreams.

Something shook me back to reality. Jane screaming my name and shaking my shoulders. The horror movie I'm front of me faded away, replaced by my normal living room.

"You're having a nightmare Josh!" Jane was screaming.

I looked around panicked.

"I was asleep?" I asked. "I haven't slept in 3 days."

"No, Josh. You've only been home from work for 10 hours. You've been in and out of sleep. You're sleeping with your eyes open!" She practically sobbed.

That pill had really fucked me up. I promised not to take anymore of them, and resolved to tell my experience to Eddie and Mike. I actually felt better in the morning, I guess the pill had left my system. Thankfully I wasn't experiencing withdrawal.

I called Eddie that morning, assuming he had suffered a similar experience. As soon he answered he said we needed to meet immediately. I took this as a sign that he was in the same boat as me.

The three of us met later that day in Mike's basement, where he had set up his lab. Mike was aghast as I told my story. Eddie, however, looked unfazed.

I ended my narrative by saying that we needed to abort the project, or make serious changes.

"But why? Everything is going as I planned." Eddie stated coldly.

Before I could process or react to what he said, I felt a pair of hands on my shoulders and the stick of a needle in my neck.

And then, nothing but blackness.
author: Clarkinator69
